required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Safety,Tolerability and Efficacy of PF-04360365 in Adults With Probable Cerebral Amyloid Angiopathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double Blind Placebo Controlled Trial To Evaluate The Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics And Efficacy Of Pf-04360365 (Ponezumab) In Adult Subjects With Probable Cerebral Amyloid Angiopathy

brief_summary.textblock: Cerebral Amyloid Angiopathy (CAA) is a condition caused by the build-up of a protein called amyloid, predominantly AÎ²40, within the walls of brain blood vessels, especially those blood vessels in the occipital lobe of the brain. Probable CAA may be defined as two or more hemorrhages in the brain cortex in individuals 55 years of age or older. This study will examine the study drug (PF-04360365) vs. placebo (saline) at 10 mg/kg - Day 1 and the maintenance dose of the study drug (PF-04360365) vs. placebo (saline) at 7.5mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Subjects will be followed for 6 months after receiving the last dose of study medication.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 2 in Cerebrovascular Reactivity as Measured by the Slope (Amplitude Over Time to Peak) From Visual Task-evoked Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI)
primary_outcome.description: Blood Oxygen Level Dependant (BOLD) fMRI was performed at Screening (Baseline) and on Days 2 and 90. During each of these sessions, BOLD fMRI images were acquired in rapid succession as a flashing radial black and white checkerboard was presented alternately with a gray screen. This well established visual stimulus is known to produce a reliable increase in BOLD fMRI signal within the visual cortex region of the occipital lobe. The time course of the BOLD fMRI signal was used to assess the vascular reactivity. Imaging sites also acquired cerebral blood flow data using Arterial Spin Labeled (ASL) scans at Screening and on Days 2 and 90. A standard T1-weighted image was also acquired to aid image analysis. All efficacy scans were analyzed centrally. Geometric means are presented in the original scale and standard errors (SE) are presented in logarithmic (log e) scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 90 in Cerebrovascular Reactivity as Measured by the Slope (Amplitude Over Time to Peak) From Visual Task-evoked fMRI
primary_outcome.description: BOLD fMRI was performed at Screening (Baseline) and on Days 2 and 90. During each of these sessions, BOLD fMRI images were acquired in rapid succession as a flashing radial black and white checkerboard was presented alternately with a gray screen. This well established visual stimulus is known to produce a reliable increase in BOLD fMRI signal within the visual cortex region of the occipital lobe. The time course of the BOLD fMRI signal was used to assess the vascular reactivity. Imaging sites also acquired cerebral blood flow data using ASL scans at Screening and on Days 2 and 90. A standard T1-weighted image was also acquired to aid image analysis. All efficacy scans were analyzed centrally. Geometric means are presented in the original scale and SEs are presented in log e scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 2 and Day 90 in Cerebrovascular Reactivity as Measured by the Time to Peak From Visual Task-evoked fMRI
secondary_outcome.description: BOLD fMRI was performed at Screening (Baseline) and on Days 2 and 90. During each of these sessions, BOLD fMRI images were acquired in rapid succession as a flashing radial black and white checkerboard was presented alternately with a gray screen. This well established visual stimulus is known to produce a reliable increase in BOLD fMRI signal within the visual cortex region of the occipital lobe. The time course of the BOLD fMRI signal was used to assess the vascular reactivity. Imaging sites also acquired cerebral blood flow data using ASL scans at Screening and on Days 2 and 90. A standard T1-weighted image was also acquired to aid image analysis. All efficacy scans were analyzed centrally. Geometric means are presented in the original scale and SEs are presented in log e scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 2 and Day 90 in Cerebrovascular Reactivity as Measured by the Amplitude From Visual Task-evoked fMRI
secondary_outcome.description: BOLD fMRI was performed at Screening (Baseline) and on Days 2 and 90. During each of these sessions, BOLD fMRI images were acquired in rapid succession as a flashing radial black and white checkerboard was presented alternately with a gray screen. This well established visual stimulus is known to produce a reliable increase in BOLD fMRI signal within the visual cortex region of the occipital lobe. The time course of the BOLD fMRI signal was used to assess the vascular reactivity. Imaging sites also acquired cerebral blood flow data using ASL scans at Screening and on Days 2 and 90. A standard T1-weighted image was also acquired to aid image analysis. All efficacy scans were analyzed centrally. All values are presented in log e scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 2 and Day 90 in Cerebrovascular Reactivity as Measured by the Time to Return to Baseline From Visual Task-evoked fMRI
secondary_outcome.description: BOLD fMRI was performed at Screening (Baseline) and on Days 2 and 90. During each of these sessions, BOLD fMRI images were acquired in rapid succession as a flashing radial black and white checkerboard was presented alternately with a gray screen. This well established visual stimulus is known to produce a reliable increase in BOLD fMRI signal within the visual cortex region of the occipital lobe. The time course of the BOLD fMRI signal was used to assess the vascular reactivity. Imaging sites also acquired cerebral blood flow data using ASL scans at Screening and on Days 2 and 90. A standard T1-weighted image was also acquired to aid image analysis. All efficacy scans were analyzed centrally. All values are presented in log e scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Concentration of Total Plasma Amyloid Beta (AB)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 8 hours post dose on Day 1, Day 2, Day 30, 90 and 240
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA) is caused by the progressive deposition of amyloid, predominantly AB40, within the walls of cerebral blood vessels with a predisposition for the vessels of the occipital lobe. As such, it is of interest to investigate the effect of PF-04360365 on AB concentrations. AB1-x and AB1-40 were investigated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Brain Structural Magnetic Resonance Imaging (sMRI) Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Brain sMRI abnormalities included cerebral edema and total infarcts (including cortical infarcts, white matter infarcts, and subcortical gray matter infarcts). "Total infarcts" is the total number of participants with at least 1 type of infarct.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) Total Score Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: The Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) was used as a safety outcome measure to assess any changes in cognition. The MoCA is a 1-page 30-point test administered in approximately 10 minutes. The MoCA assessed short term memory, visuospatial abilities, multiple aspects of executive functions, attention, concentration, working memory, and language, as well as orientation to time and place. The total scale ranges from 0 to 30, with lower numbers indicating lower cognition performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With All Causality and Treatment-related Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. AEs comprised both SAEs and non-SAEs. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: deathÍ¾ initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalizationÍ¾ life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying)Í¾ persistent or significant disability/incapacityÍ¾ congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were defined as newly occurring AEs or those worsening after first dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with laboratory test abnormalities without regard to baseline abnormality. Laboratory test parameters included hematology, liver function (including Hy's Law Criteria), renal function, electrolytes, clinical chemistry, and urinalysis (dipstick and microscopy).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Vital Signs Values Meeting Categorical Summarization Criteria
secondary_outcome.description: Categorical summarization criteria in vital signs included: supine systolic blood pressure (SBP) of less than (<)90 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) or more than (>) 160 mm Hg; supine diastolic blood pressure (DBP) <50 mm Hg or >100 mm Hg; supine pulse rate of <60 beats per minute (bpm) or >100 bpm; maximum changes (increase or decrease) from baseline in supine SBP of >=20 mm Hg; maximum increase from baseline in supine DBP of >=20 mm Hg; and maximum decrease from baseline in supine DBP of >=10 mm Hg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Number of Participants With Positive Responses to Questions on the Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS)
secondary_outcome.description: C-SSRS assessed whether participant responded "yes" to the following: completed suicide, suicide attempt, preparatory acts toward imminent suicidal behavior, suicidal ideation, self-injurious behavior with no suicidal intent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Significant Changes From Baseline in Physical Examination at Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: A complete physical examination included head, ears, eyes, nose, mouth, skin, heart and lung examinations, lymph nodes, gastrointestinal, skeletal, and neurological systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Significant Changes in Neurological Examination Results
secondary_outcome.description: A complete/full neurological examination included assessment of the cranial nerves; muscle strength, tone, cortical drift, abnormal movements; deep tendon reflexes; sensory exam, coordination, gait and station.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti-PF-04360365 Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected from participants who received active treatment to assess for presence/absence of anti-PF-04360365 antibodies.

intervention.description: Infusion of Ponezumab (Day 1=10mg/kg; Day 30 and Day 60 dose = 7.5mg/kg) or placebo (saline); administered via infusion for a total infusion time of 20 minutes.
placebo (saline)- given via infusion total infusion time of 20 minutes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with probable CAA using the Boston criteria; with no clinical cognitive impairment
- In general good health
Exclusion Criteria:
- Co-morbid diagnosis of clinically documented Alzheimer's disease or significant cognitive impairment
- Clinically significant syncope, epilepsy, head trauma or clinically significant unexplained loss of consciousness within the last 5 years
- Subject's body weight exceeding 100kg
- Women of childbearing potential.

facility.name: Anthinoula A. Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging
CHRU de Lille - HÃ´pital Roger Salengro

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

baseline.population: All participants assigned to study treatment were included in the baseline analysis population.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.population: The full analysis set (FAS) consisted of all participants who received at least 1 post-dose efficacy measurement. n=number of evaluable participants for the specified region of interest (ROI) at Day 2.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Day 2 in Cerebrovascular Reactivity as Measured by the Slope (Amplitude Over Time to Peak) From Visual Task-evoked Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI)
measure.description: Blood Oxygen Level Dependant (BOLD) fMRI was performed at Screening (Baseline) and on Days 2 and 90. During each of these sessions, BOLD fMRI images were acquired in rapid succession as a flashing radial black and white checkerboard was presented alternately with a gray screen. This well established visual stimulus is known to produce a reliable increase in BOLD fMRI signal within the visual cortex region of the occipital lobe. The time course of the BOLD fMRI signal was used to assess the vascular reactivity. Imaging sites also acquired cerebral blood flow data using Arterial Spin Labeled (ASL) scans at Screening and on Days 2 and 90. A standard T1-weighted image was also acquired to aid image analysis. All efficacy scans were analyzed centrally. Geometric means are presented in the original scale and standard errors (SE) are presented in logarithmic (log e) scale.
measure.population: The full analysis set (FAS) consisted of all participants who received at least 1 post-dose efficacy measurement. n=number of evaluable participants for the specified region of interest (ROI) at Day 2.

analysis.groups_desc: ROI1: Analysis of the change from baseline in log(slope) was carried out using a Bayesian linear model (ANCOVA). Treatment was a fixed effect within the model and the log(slope) at baseline was included as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: SE of mean is presented in log e scale.

analysis.groups_desc: ROI2: Analysis of the change from baseline in log(slope) was carried out using a Bayesian linear model (ANCOVA). Treatment was a fixed effect within the model and the log(slope) at baseline was included as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: SE of mean is presented in log e scale.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Concentration of Total Plasma Amyloid Beta (AB)
outcome.description: Cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA) is caused by the progressive deposition of amyloid, predominantly AB40, within the walls of cerebral blood vessels with a predisposition for the vessels of the occipital lobe. As such, it is of interest to investigate the effect of PF-04360365 on AB concentrations. AB1-x and AB1-40 were investigated.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 8 hours post dose on Day 1, Day 2, Day 30, 90 and 240
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study treatment were included in this pharmacodynamic analysis. n=number of participants with measurable AB at the specified time point.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Concentration of Total Plasma Amyloid Beta (AB)
measure.description: Cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA) is caused by the progressive deposition of amyloid, predominantly AB40, within the walls of cerebral blood vessels with a predisposition for the vessels of the occipital lobe. As such, it is of interest to investigate the effect of PF-04360365 on AB concentrations. AB1-x and AB1-40 were investigated.
measure.population: All 36 participants who received study treatment were included in this pharmacodynamic analysis. n=number of participants with measurable AB at the specified time point.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Brain Structural Magnetic Resonance Imaging (sMRI) Abnormalities
outcome.description: Brain sMRI abnormalities included cerebral edema and total infarcts (including cortical infarcts, white matter infarcts, and subcortical gray matter infarcts). "Total infarcts" is the total number of participants with at least 1 type of infarct.
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study treatment were analyzed for this endpoint.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Brain Structural Magnetic Resonance Imaging (sMRI) Abnormalities
measure.description: Brain sMRI abnormalities included cerebral edema and total infarcts (including cortical infarcts, white matter infarcts, and subcortical gray matter infarcts). "Total infarcts" is the total number of participants with at least 1 type of infarct.
measure.population: All 36 participants who received study treatment were analyzed for this endpoint.

outcome.title: Mean Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) Total Score Over Time
outcome.description: The Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) was used as a safety outcome measure to assess any changes in cognition. The MoCA is a 1-page 30-point test administered in approximately 10 minutes. The MoCA assessed short term memory, visuospatial abilities, multiple aspects of executive functions, attention, concentration, working memory, and language, as well as orientation to time and place. The total scale ranges from 0 to 30, with lower numbers indicating lower cognition performance.
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study treatment were included in the analysis. On Day 240, the number of evaluable participants in the placebo group was 11 instead of 12.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

measure.title: Mean Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) Total Score Over Time
measure.description: The Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) was used as a safety outcome measure to assess any changes in cognition. The MoCA is a 1-page 30-point test administered in approximately 10 minutes. The MoCA assessed short term memory, visuospatial abilities, multiple aspects of executive functions, attention, concentration, working memory, and language, as well as orientation to time and place. The total scale ranges from 0 to 30, with lower numbers indicating lower cognition performance.
measure.population: All 36 participants who received study treatment were included in the analysis. On Day 240, the number of evaluable participants in the placebo group was 11 instead of 12.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With All Causality and Treatment-related Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. AEs comprised both SAEs and non-SAEs. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: deathÍ¾ initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalizationÍ¾ life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying)Í¾ persistent or significant disability/incapacityÍ¾ congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were defined as newly occurring AEs or those worsening after first dose.
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the AE summarization/analysis.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

measure.title: Number of Participants With All Causality and Treatment-related Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. AEs comprised both SAEs and non-SAEs. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: deathÍ¾ initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalizationÍ¾ life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying)Í¾ persistent or significant disability/incapacityÍ¾ congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were defined as newly occurring AEs or those worsening after first dose.
measure.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the AE summarization/analysis.

class.title: Discontinued due to all causality TEAEs

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: Number of participants with laboratory test abnormalities without regard to baseline abnormality. Laboratory test parameters included hematology, liver function (including Hy's Law Criteria), renal function, electrolytes, clinical chemistry, and urinalysis (dipstick and microscopy).
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities
measure.description: Number of participants with laboratory test abnormalities without regard to baseline abnormality. Laboratory test parameters included hematology, liver function (including Hy's Law Criteria), renal function, electrolytes, clinical chemistry, and urinalysis (dipstick and microscopy).
measure.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Vital Signs Values Meeting Categorical Summarization Criteria
outcome.description: Categorical summarization criteria in vital signs included: supine systolic blood pressure (SBP) of less than (<)90 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) or more than (>) 160 mm Hg; supine diastolic blood pressure (DBP) <50 mm Hg or >100 mm Hg; supine pulse rate of <60 beats per minute (bpm) or >100 bpm; maximum changes (increase or decrease) from baseline in supine SBP of >=20 mm Hg; maximum increase from baseline in supine DBP of >=20 mm Hg; and maximum decrease from baseline in supine DBP of >=10 mm Hg.
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Vital Signs Values Meeting Categorical Summarization Criteria
measure.description: Categorical summarization criteria in vital signs included: supine systolic blood pressure (SBP) of less than (<)90 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) or more than (>) 160 mm Hg; supine diastolic blood pressure (DBP) <50 mm Hg or >100 mm Hg; supine pulse rate of <60 beats per minute (bpm) or >100 bpm; maximum changes (increase or decrease) from baseline in supine SBP of >=20 mm Hg; maximum increase from baseline in supine DBP of >=20 mm Hg; and maximum decrease from baseline in supine DBP of >=10 mm Hg.
measure.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

class.title: Increase from baseline in supine SBP >=20 mm Hg
Increase from baseline in supine DBP >=20 mm Hg
Decrease from baseline in supine SBP >=20 mm Hg
Decrease from baseline in supine DBP >=10 mm Hg

outcome.title: Overall Number of Participants With Positive Responses to Questions on the Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS)
outcome.description: C-SSRS assessed whether participant responded "yes" to the following: completed suicide, suicide attempt, preparatory acts toward imminent suicidal behavior, suicidal ideation, self-injurious behavior with no suicidal intent.
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

measure.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

class.title: Preparatory acts to imminent suicidal behaviour

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Significant Changes From Baseline in Physical Examination at Final Visit
outcome.description: A complete physical examination included head, ears, eyes, nose, mouth, skin, heart and lung examinations, lymph nodes, gastrointestinal, skeletal, and neurological systems.
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Significant Changes in Neurological Examination Results
outcome.description: A complete/full neurological examination included assessment of the cranial nerves; muscle strength, tone, cortical drift, abnormal movements; deep tendon reflexes; sensory exam, coordination, gait and station.
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Significant Changes in Neurological Examination Results
measure.description: A complete/full neurological examination included assessment of the cranial nerves; muscle strength, tone, cortical drift, abnormal movements; deep tendon reflexes; sensory exam, coordination, gait and station.
measure.population: All 36 participants who received study drug were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Anti-PF-04360365 Antibodies
outcome.description: Blood samples were collected from participants who received active treatment to assess for presence/absence of anti-PF-04360365 antibodies.
outcome.population: All 24 participants who received PF-04360365 were included in this analysis.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Anti-PF-04360365 Antibodies
measure.description: Blood samples were collected from participants who received active treatment to assess for presence/absence of anti-PF-04360365 antibodies.
measure.population: All 24 participants who received PF-04360365 were included in this analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) and serious AEs (SAEs) monitoring started from screening through and including 28 calendar days after the last administration of the investigational product.
reported_events.desc: All treated participants were analyzed for AEs. The same event may appear as both an AE and an SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and a nonserious event during the study.

group.title: PF-04360365
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of PF-04360365 10 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) on Day 1, followed by PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. PF-04360365 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over a period of 10-15 minutes (min) and dosing was based on participant weight.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received a loading dose of placebo matching PF-04360365 10 mg/kg on Day 1, followed by placebo matching PF-04360365 7.5 mg/kg on Days 30 and 60. Placebo was also administered via IV infusion over a period of 10-15 min.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Superficial siderosis of central nervous system

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
